**Description:**

* Job Title: **Lifecycle Marketing Manager** – ABC Carpet & Home Flagship Store, NYC
* Location: New York City, NY
* Position Type: Full-Time, On-Site

Join Our Team at ABC Carpet & Home - Flagship, New York

**ABC Carpet & Home 's Mission:**

Known as the most iconic Home Design destination in New York, our mission is to bring our magic and colorful vision to the world through a unique and unparalleled curation of rugs, furniture and décor.

ABC Carpet & Home is a 150+ year old privately and family-owned company with an entrepreneurial culture.

We are currently seeking a dedicated and experienced **Lifecycle Marketing Manager** to join our New York team.

**The Opportunity:**

We are a luxury home and carpet store seeking an experienced Lifecycle Marketing Manager to join our team. This person will be responsible for developing and optimizing multi-channel customer journeys to drive engagement, retention, and revenue throughout the customer lifecycle. This role will own the strategy and execution of programs across email, SMS, direct mail, and other channels, using data-driven insights to deliver personalized experiences at scale.They should be comfortable implementing brand strategies, marketing plans, and project management for all marketing initiatives, and working cross-functionally to execute these strategies. This is a full-time position in office.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Drive strong email and SMS campaigns to acquire and retain customers across our product portfolio
* Spearhead all new marketing product launches to drive repeat and new revenue
* Coordinate cross-functionally to ensure consistency in brand-related decisions
* Analyze and report on brand performance across channels, including but not limited to: direct mail, email, SMS
* Monitor market and consumer trends within the interior design and home space
* Project management for all marketing projects, serving as the glue between dev, merchandising, and ecomm teams

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree
* 3-6+ years of experience in lifecycle, retention, or CRM marketing, preferably in a direct-to-consumer or ecommerce environment.
* Proven success managing customer journeys and automated campaigns across digital channels.
* Strong analytical mindset; comfortable working with large datasets and drawing actionable insights.
* Hands-on experience with marketing automation platforms and CRM tools.
* Excellent project management skills with the ability to lead cross-functional initiatives.
* Strong copywriting skills and a keen eye for creative and brand voice.
* Passionate about customer experience, personalization, and performance marketing.
* Experience in home furnishings or interior design is preferred but not required
* Experience working in: Klaviyo, Attentive, Google Analytics, Shopify, Asana a plus.

**Compensation Details:**

Starting Salary:

We offer a competitive salary ranging from $90,000 to $110,000, depending on your experience and qualifications. Our commitment to equitable pay means we regularly adjust our ranges to stay compliant with state and local laws, ensuring our team members are rewarded fairly for their expertise and dedication.

About Us:

Founded in 1992, Pennsylvania, USA, by current URBN chairman and president Dick Hayne, Anthropologie was named after his college major (with a decidedly French twist) Anthropologie, which now operates over 200 stores worldwide, has evolved into a leading one-of-a-kind destination for those seeking a curated mix of clothing, accessories, gifts and home décor to reflect their personal style. In 2009 the brand launched its first store in London and now has over 18 stores in the UK and Europe.

Role Summary:

**This is a 12 month FTC and we are looking for a start date of March/beginning of April**

As Digital Merchandising & Production Manager, you’ll lead the visual merchandising and digital content strategy across our e-commerce platform. Acting as the bridge between trading, buying, marketing, and tech teams, you’ll oversee the execution of homepage, category, and product pages to reflect commercial priorities and brand goals. You’ll also drive product activation, manage the digital product pipeline, and champion SEO and content enhancements to elevate the customer journey. With a strong grasp of systems and a proactive approach to system optimisations, you’ll play a key role in shaping the future of our digital experience. You will be managing and supporting a team.

What You'll Be Doing:

Merchandising & Site Content

* Own & deliver on visual site merchandising strategy
* Owns all content on site, ensuring engaging and inspiring to support customer discoverability
* Works closely with Trade on successful execution of site strategy across page optimisations, content callouts, filters, category structure, page merchandising and other site changes to support product discoverability & CVR.
* Oversees execution of homepage & other content pages and ensure they reflect trading priorities and CVR optimisations alongside brand goals
* Liaison between buying, marketing to ensure campaign launch ready (site, product, links..)

Tech & System Optimisations

* Champion tech roadmap optimisations & a go between tech and the business
* Reports tech issues & liaises with tech on issues & opportunities
* Systems expert & seeks opportunities to improve processes

Product Activation

* Plan & oversee product launches across the website
* Manages the digital product pipeline and ensures accurate, timely product uploads in coordination with Buying and Planning.
* Owns product attribution, SEO tagging, and content optimization (e.g., product descriptions, imagery, styling).
* Identifies and resolves product & content gaps to support conversion and improve the customer journey

What You'll Need:

* A proactive, positive and energetic attitude, you’re someone who gets stuck in, solves problems quickly, and brings ideas to the table with enthusiasm
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a sharp eye for emerging talent and unique opportunities
* Management experience
* Strong experience tracking, analysing and reporting on both digital and physical activations
* A people-first attitude and the ability to build rapport quickly both internally and externally
* Super-organised whilst still being flexible, with the ability to juggle multiple projects, meet deadlines and stay calm under pressure
* Digitally confident, with strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite
* Familiarity with performance-tracking tools essential, both native metrics and 3rd-party platforms (i.e. Dash Social, GRIN, Plot)
* Creative and commercially aware, always thinking about how to drive awareness and impact for the brand

The Perks:

* Work-life balance:

* Flexible start and finish times
* Bring your dog to work
* Wellbeing:

* Employees Assistance program to support with mental, physical and financial health
* Fully equipped free gym and on-site wellness room in Brick Lane and 50% discount of external gym memberships
* Private Medical Insurance
* Employee Discount:
* Up to 40% off at all URBN Brands
* Community:
* One paid day to either volunteer or fundraise for a charity of your choice
* Travel:
* Cycle to work scheme, season ticket loan
* Continued Development:
* We offer structured support within the business alongside continued learning and development

#AnthroEU

Equal Opportunity Statement:

URBN is an Equal Opportunities Employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We provide equal employment opportunities regardless of age, sexual orientation, sex, gender reassignment, pregnancy, marital status, religion, race, or disability. We base all our employment decisions on merit, job requirements and business needs.

Anthropologie is looking for an Influencer Marketing Coordinator. The Influencer Marketing Coordinator will support the day-to-day of the Anthropologie influencer marketing team. This person will report to the Influencer Marketing Associate and partner with Anthropologie’s crossfunctional teams to support the execution of the Anthropologie, AnthroLiving and BHLDN influencer campaigns and giftings.  
  
**Role Responsibilities**

* Assist in management of Influencer campaigns for Anthropologie , AnthroLiving and AnthroWeddings. Including but not limited to:

+ Expand Anthropologie brand awareness by staying up-to-date on up-and-coming influencers excelling in reach and engagement KPIs as well as brand relevant content to test within Anthropologie campaigns
+ Assist in the curation of face sheets, cast scouting for campaigns and contracts
+ Manage campaign timelines and coordination of campaign launch from following up of content concepts, placing product orders, managing content deadlines, initial content approvals, tracking live content and reporting
+ Ensure that product selections adhere to campaign concept and brief parameters prior to placing orders as well as site availability. When orders are placed, manage all steps inclusive of order tracking & resolving order issues
+ Curate product SKU lists to pass off to web dev. team for anthropologie.com linking purposes and create UTMs to provide Influencers for content
+ Capture live content inclusive of IG Stories and ensuring all deliverable obligations are met and track all content on monday.com
+ Ensure social teams are supporting live influencer content via community management
+ Coordinate with digital team on content available for paid social needs and assist in whitelisting strategy by ensuring branded content tool is utilized
+ Assist in ambassador initiatives including but not limited to: campaign launch process, bonus campaigns, collecting reviews, outfitting program coordination, co-op campaigns

* Manage regular pulse of influencer giftings process including but not limited to:

+ Recommending key product gifting opportunities during key calendar moments
+ Coordinate with art team on asset needs: packaging, card inserts, handwritten notes
+ Coordinate with digital teams on landing page experiences, UTMs, QR codes, etc.
+ Coordinate with product teams to curate a personalized gifting product selection that relates to story/brand message being told via gifting
+ Place gifting product orders and manage gifting package process inclusive of sending gifts and coordinate tracking
+ Coordinate entire process of opportunistic influencer giftings
+ Assist in execution of the celebrity home giftings program including but not limited to order placements, inventory checking, landing page coordination, recapping

* Experiences and Events:

+ Assist in casting for Anthropologie brand events and experiences
+ Partner with cross functional teams on invitation assets, casting expectations, casting approvals and product orders
+ Manage outfitting process for influencer attendees

* Budget:

+ Assist in Influencer budget coordination in a timely manner including:
+ Invoice submission assistance
+ Monthly finance tracker and trial balance completion

* Recapping:

+ Ensure all influencer partners are verified on Creator IQ to accurately pull performance
+ Partner with Influencer Associate on pulling together performance metrics to create actionable takeaways and recapping for campaigns
+ Outreach to gifting recipients or event attendees for their account reporting if deliverables aren’t required
+ Responsible for recapping and reporting on content for all giftings and events

**Role Qualifications**

* Minimum 1+ years influencer management experience desired
* Obtained Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Business, Communications or related field
* A charismatic and proactive style of communication desired for external communication
* Strong organization skills inclusive of building timelines and tracking weekly and daily product orders and able to work on a variety of projects at one time in a fast-paced environment
* Strong writing and communication skills

Location:

Achieve the Anthropologie mission – to create an unimagined experience. Consistently meet or exceed the financial, operational, and visual expectations of the company.

What You'll Be Doing:

**Customer Experience:**

* Customer Connection: initiates genuine conversation to engage with the customer in a personalised way where all customers feel welcome, heard, and valued
* Selling Culture supports a selling environment in all areas of the sales floor by connecting with multiple customers and sharing product suggestions
* Omni-Channel Service: provides a frictionless customer experience by utilising technology to transact in the moment, find sizes and colours, and places orders for items not available in store

**Teamwork & Communication:**

* Team Player: builds productive relationships with peers; asks for support when needed and makes an effort to help others
* Share Knowledge: participates in the learning and sharing of product knowledge, current trends, and personal styling priorities to inspire the customer
* Employee Recognition: contributes to a positive team morale participating in store initiatives and highlighting peers and leaders through the SPARKED journal

jobs.description:
Arhaus was founded in 1986 on a simple idea: Furniture and décor should be sustainably sourced, lovingly made, and built to last. Today, we partner with artisans around the world who share our vision, creating beautiful, heirloom-quality pieces that can be used—and loved—for generations.

Arhaus is seeking a Senior Graphic Designer, Digital to join their Creative team. The ideal candidate will be able to translate strategic insights into brand defining creative storytelling, have a high attention to detail, be able to drive creative innovation, and manage the creative design process. As a Senior Graphic Designer, Digital, you'll be responsible for the concepting, execution and on-time delivery of high-quality creative materials across marketing channels with a focus on building the Arhaus brand, engaging customers, and driving business results.

**Essential Duties & Responsibilities:**

* Lead and manage the creative design process from concept to completion, ensuring that all deliverables support Arhaus brand pillars, engaging customers, and driving business results
* Partner with copywriters and marketing partners to brainstorm, design and develop creative work for various campaigns, including print ads, digital banners, social media content, and other marketing materials.
* Design materials that enhance the Arhaus brand and the overall customer experience
* Drive innovation with editorial storytelling approach that elevates customer engagement
* Provide expertise that pushes the team to do the most effective and elevated work possible
* Demonstrate exceptional creative concepting ability across multiple marketing channels, as evidenced by a diverse portfolio of work
* Translate strategic insights into effective and highly creative ideas
* Oversee and mentor designers, providing guidance and feedback to ensure their professional growth and the quality of their work.
* Partner with Marketing leads to grow the business and explore new business opportunities
* Manage multiple projects and deliverables simultaneously
* Maintain accountability for overall quality of creative work
* Conduct and participate in design reviews with a range of stakeholders across the organization

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor or Master’s degree in Advertising, Communications, Design, or other related field (or other relevant equivalent)
* 7+ years of experience in Art Direction
* Fluent in Adobe Suite
* Strong conceptual and visual storytelling skills, with an exceptional portfolio showcasing a range of campaign work..
* Strong understanding of design principles, typography, color theory, and layout design.
* Ability to balance big-picture creative thinking with hands-on design execution.
* Strong project management skills and ability to function as project leader influencing others as well as individual contributor. Able to work well in cross-functional teams.
* Strong leadership skills and the ability to mentor and guide junior team members.
* Team Player – Must be able to manage and work with various members of creative, ecommerce and social teams
* Must be organized and able to prioritize, multi-task and work independently
* Fluent in English, with excellent communication, presentation, and social skills

*About Us*

**Position Overview**

**Director of Product Marketing – OnSite: Tampa, FL**

**About the Role:**

We are seeking a seasoned **Director of Product Marketing** to define and lead the strategy, positioning, and execution of product launches across our multi-brand home and furniture portfolio. This highly visible leadership role serves as the central connector across Merchandising, Product Development, Sales, Marketing, and Creative, ensuring each product enters the market with precision, consistency, and impact. You will own the go-to-market (GTM) strategy, develop scalable product messaging and positioning frameworks, and guide a high-performing team in bringing new collections to market across direct-to-consumer, retail, wholesale, and marketplace channels. This role offers the opportunity to shape category leadership, drive meaningful growth, and elevate how our brands engage customers across a diverse and evolving landscape.

*To be considered for this opportunity, you must be able to commute to Ashley’s Corporate Office in Tampa, FL. Relocation assistance is available for qualified candidates.*

**Why This Opportunity Is Special:**

* **Build the Foundation:** This is a unique opportunity to architect the Product Marketing function from the ground up at the largest furniture manufacturer in America.
* **Lead Through Influence:** You’ll sit at the center of our business—where strategy meets storytelling and product meets customer.
* **Be a Category Shaper:** We’re launching high-velocity SKUs across multiple categories: upholstery, casegoods, motion, and bedding.
* **Join a Growth-Obsessed Team:** We move fast, think big, and iterate quickly. You'll have both leadership and ownership.

**What You’ll be Doing:**

GTM Strategy & Category Ownership

* Own and manage **go-to-market plans**, calendars, and cross-functional launch workflows across all furniture categories
* Define **product positioning**, selling narratives, and consumer-facing benefits for each channel (DTC, retail, Amazon, Wayfair, etc.)
* Drive alignment with Merchandising and Development to prioritize the right SKUs for each seasonal launch

Messaging & Content Briefing

* Write and evolve **core messaging documents** and storytelling frameworks that drive marketing campaigns, packaging, PDPs, and retail content
* Partner with Creative and Brand teams to brief on **imagery, video, 3D renderings, and copy** needed for launch assets
* Ensure **channel-ready content** is accurate, timely, and compliant with each retailer or platform

Hub Between Departments

* Act as the central bridge between **Product Development, Merchandising, Sales, Creative, and Marketing**
* Align on timelines, product specifications, messaging priorities, and asset needs
* Run cross-functional meetings and checkpoints to keep all teams informed and accountable

Product Accuracy & Consumer Insights

* Partner with Data & Insights to validate claims, track reviews, and refine positioning over time
* Ensure accuracy of product names, specifications, claims, dimensions, and visual representation
* Maintain centralized systems for product content readiness and version control

Team Leadership

* Build and manage a high-performing team:
* Product Marketing Managers (by category)
* Content & Readiness Manager
* Launch Project Manager

Optional: Insights Analyst

* Foster a team culture of collaboration, creativity, and continuous improvement

**Skills & Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree required; advanced degree preferred
* 8–10 years of progressive experience in product marketing, brand marketing, or category leadership—ideally within home, furniture, or consumer goods industries
* Demonstrated success leading product launches across multiple channels, with expertise in DTC, marketplace, and wholesale environments
* Proven people leadership experience within high-growth, fast-paced businesses
* Strong ability to collaborate across functions, with direct experience partnering with Merchandising, Sales, Product Development, Creative, and Retail Marketing teams
* Exceptional communication, strategic thinking, and execution skills with a strong bias toward results
* Ability and willingness to travel as needed to support business objectives
* Background in organizations such as Wayfair, Amazon, Home Depot, or Steelcase a plus

*Reports to:*Head Merchant/Marketplace Category Lead & Chief Creative Officer

*Level:* Director (8–10 years experience)

**What We Offer** *(subject to eligibility requirements)***:**

Benefits: When you join our family, you are eligible to participate in our comprehensive benefits programs which includes Health, Dental, Vision, Life/Disability, Flexible Spending Accounts, 401(k), Paid Holidays, Paid Vacation. Benefits may vary based on position and location, so we encourage you to speak with the recruiting team during the interview process.

**Our Core Values:**

* Honesty & Integrity
* Passion, Drive, Discipline
* Continuous Improvement/Operational Excellence

* Growth Focused

**Marketing Specialist, Partnerships – OnSite: Tampa, FL**

Ashley is seeking a Specialist, Strategic Partnerships to join our dynamic Field Marketing & Partnerships team. This role is your gateway to managing a large sports & entertainment portfolio spanning NFL, NBA, MLB, NHL, and top collegiate programs.

**What You'll Do:**

You'll be the driving force behind 40+ activations across 9 professional and 3 collegiate partnerships, executing everything from in-venue signage and paid media campaigns to VIP hospitality and sweepstakes. **Strategic Planning**

* Identify market-specific opportunities and challenges within assigned territories

* Support new store openings and Electronics category expansions

* Document management system

* Maintain confidentiality

BASIC FUNCTION

The Sales Associate has the primary responsibility to maximize sales volume by growing existing business, developing new business, and providing the best possible customer service while enhancing Baker’s mission to offer the highest quality and service standards in the industry.

SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES: Customer Communication

• Greet customers in a friendly, professional manner and in a timely fashion (5 minutes or less).

• Assist all customers as called in rotation.

• Create and maintain quotations for customers who come into the Showroom or who call for information.

• Follow up on all quotations within one week and on a weekly basis.

• Inform customers of price increases two weeks prior to the increase occurring.

• Inform customers of discontinued product, extended lead times, etc.

• Provide customers with product information.

• Follow up with a thank you note or phone call to all new customers who come into the Showroom.

• Assist the designer’s client when the designer is unavailable.

• Assist end users when available or when requested by the manager.

• Always maintain professional courtesy with associates and customers.

• Consistently practice proper telephone etiquette.

• Return phone calls within 24 hours.

• Communicate with Showroom receptionist as to whereabouts if absent from Showroom. Order Entry

• Enter all orders into the system within 24 hours of receipt of the deposit or the purchase order (for net 30 accounts). Include all necessary information on the purchase order (i.e., customer information, delivery information, product options, pricing, etc.)

• Provide an adequate explanation to the customer for all denials of special requests on product and/or delivery dates. Customer Service

• Review the purchase order once it is generated and confirm its receipt by the factory. Return checked purchase orders to the Customer Service Associate within 24 hours.

• Check factory acknowledgments and verify that the product has been ordered correctly. Report to the Customer Service Associate any incorrect acknowledgment with corrections in writing.

• Track receipt by factory of COM (customer’s own material) fabric, finish samples or any other materials required for completion of order.

• Review the Open Order Report and address any problems.

• Send thank you cards to customers after placing an order.

• Call customers periodically with updated information regarding status of the order.

• Once the product is shipped, contact customers to ensure the product and the service are acceptable.

• Partnering with Regional Account Coordinator, alert customers when product arrives at the distribution center that a remaining balance invoice will be sent. Inform customers that their payment may be sent prior to

2

receiving the invoice for more timely receipt of product. Apprise Net 30 customers when product arrives at distribution center and notify that shipment to the local receiver will occur shortly.

• Assist Regional Account Coordinator in handling customer claims; monitor progress of customer complaint resolutions and communicate updates to customers. Customer Development and Maintenance

• Provide personal accounts with information regarding current and upcoming Showroom events and sales.

• Provide customers with materials and catalogues for their libraries.

• Participate in design-oriented events to ensure visibility and contact with current and potential customers.

• Maintain updated customer information including contact data, special interests, etc.

• Maintain updated calendar of customer special dates (events, installations, publications, etc.).

• Identify and implement ways to prospect new customers and increase conversion of turns to personal accounts. Showroom Responsibilities

• Assist in the display maintenance of the showroom to ensure optimum showroom appearance.

• Assist other Sales Associates as necessary or as directed by the Showroom Manager.

• Assist in the maintenance of samples, tear sheets and resource files.

• Assist in product training and mentoring of new Sales Associates.

• Ensure catalogs and price lists are up to date.

• Product Knowledge

• Maintain knowledge of all vendor products, pricing, options, finishes, details, etc.

• Maintain thorough, up-to-date knowledge of all products, pricing, and local competition.

EDUCATIONAL AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:

Bachelor's Degree Preferred. Candidate will possess previous 3-5 years of high-end sales/customer experience, preferably in the furniture/design industry. Basic knowledge of the history of furniture design (periods, styles, designers, etc.) is preferred.

Baker is an equal opportunity employer.

**The Opportunity**Our retail expansion in the primary markets starts with hiring the best leaders. As a Sales/Operations Manager, you will focus on operational activities to grow the business. You will promote the Ballard Designs brand at every guest encounter and ensure your stellar team exemplifies brand values, standards, and experience. The dynamic energy from your leadership will increase company programs, increase sales, and set your store to exceed all expectations.  
  
You will report to the store leader.  
  
Your hiring location is **Tampa, Florida****Who We Are**Since 1982, Ballard Designs has offered a unique curation of home furnishings and décor from all periods and provenance. Its designers travel the world for inspiration, translating the latest fashion, color, and style trends into finely crafted products not found anywhere else. Ballard Designs is part of the Cornerstone brands - four interactive, aspirational home and apparel lifestyle brands that deliver inspirations that help customers enjoy, enhance, and celebrate life.  
  
**Your Impact**

* Perform a variety of operational activities, including scheduling, inventory management, backroom organization & store maintenance
* Experience with 'Division of Responsibility' understanding, competent in merchandise flow processes, including inspecting and receiving new merchandise and entering data into the inventory management system
* Manage the performance of the associates and provide feedback.

* Proficient in Excel, PowerPoint, and common project management tools (e.g., Slack, Asana, Jira).

* Self-starter with the ability to work independently and manage workload effectively within part-time hours.

**Job Description**The Director of eCommerce (Temporary) will play a significant role in building a best‐in‐class global eCommerce website and creating a superior home décor shopping experience. This role will be accountable for driving and monitoring our webstore performance via effective merchandising, A/B testing, personalization, and optimization projects. This person will be a key stakeholder in the creation of the eCommerce roadmap and a key contributor to our company roadmap and annual priorities.  
  
The Director of eCommerce (Temporary) will work closely with Product Management, UI/UX, Marketing, and Creative teams to build a conversion‐driven website design that supports the brand vision and seasonal campaigns and proves our brand value to our shoppers. This person will also work closely with Product Management and Technology teams to identify technology, processes, eCommerce software, and feature improvements that contribute to the overall growth and profitability of the business**.**This position reports to the VP of eCommerce and is based in our Redwood City office location. This role is expected to work in a hybrid model, which currently includes Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday in-office.  
  
**What You’ll Do**

* Guide and support a global team of eCommerce Merchandisers to deliver best in class shopping experiences on our international sites
* Oversee development of eCommerce site strategies including navigation, landing experiences, site search, and other tactical plans that will help meet and exceed conversion, revenue and profitability goals
* Participate in evaluating tool and systems opportunities that drive eCommerce features and efficiencies, including use of technology to deliver a best‐in‐class personalized merchandising experience
* Oversee eCommerce day‐to‐day responsibilities, including:
* Drive improvement for key page/category metrics (conversion, bounce, exit, revenue, engagement, etc.) through the optimization of online merchandising that enhances overall customer experience
* Drive innovation and optimization through testing and application of eCommerce best practices
* Monitor, meet, and report on eCommerce KPI's (conversion, bounce/exit, cart abandon, RPV, brand/category revenue, etc.) across devices, pages, and customer segments, and be able to explain the business drivers behind fluctuations in these metrics
* Collaborate with the Marketing, SEO, Merchants, Pricing, and Planning teams to define business goals for our brands to align on strategies that drive growth
* Partner with Creative by contributing to creative briefs, reviewing creative concepts against business goals, and identifying asset requirements
* Partner with Merchandising (physical product) to ensure that product goals and benefits are being translated onto our site in a way that is consistent with their strategies
* Partner with Product Management and Technology teams to ensure technical support for the execution of eCommerce projects and website operations
* Provide input for prioritization of eCommerce projects, bug fixes, and maintenance tasks that go to Website Operations, Creative, and/or Technology teams

* 14+ years of experience in eCommerce/Retail
* Exceptional analytical skills required
* Prior experience managing teams required; remote management preferred
* Ability to influence across functions and communicate across levels
* Prior experience in leading cross functional projects
* Experience in working with Creative, Product Management and/or Technology teams
* Bachelor’s Degree in Merchandising, Economics, General Business Management or equivalent

The Account Executive will play a hand in evolving the product assortment by sharing client feedback and work closely with the Customer Success team to ensure a seamless customer experience.As a brand ambassador for Balsam Hill, the Account Executive will lead engagement with key design industry associations to enhance the company’s presence and position Balsam Hill as the preferred partner for design professionals. Additionally, the Account Executive will play an integral role in establishing a nationwide network of designers and decorators who may be contracted to support holiday installations.This full-time position reports to the Director of Customer Engagement, B2B and can work remote from any U.S. state where Balsam Brands is currently setup as an employer, which includes Arizona, California, Illinois and Texas. This role can also work locally in our Redwood City, CA location. Our local teams work in a hybrid model, which currently includes Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday in-office.To ensure sufficient overlap with functional and cross-functional team members globally, some flexibility with this role's regular work schedule will be required. Most of our teams have overlap with early morning and/or early evening PST. Specific scheduling needs for this role will be discussed in the initial interview.What you’ll do:New Business Acquisition:Own the full sales cycle from prospecting through close, selling to interior designers, event planners, and similar professionals, and independently managing a national territoryDesigner Network Development(Secondary Focus): Identify, recruit, and build relationships with a network of designers and decorators across the country who can support holiday installations for high-end clientsEvent & Industry Representation: Represent Balsam Hill at industry events, trade shows, and conferences (e.g., ASID Gather), enhancing brand visibility and building strong industry partnershipsABM and Prospecting: Work in partnership with the marketing team to leverage ABM strategy, buyer intent tools, and social media to engage high-potential clientsSales Collateral:Collaborate with internal teams to develop persuasive sales tools and presentations tailored to design industry prospectCRM and Technology: Use HubSpot for pipeline management, ZoomInfo for lead insights, and LinkedIn Sales Navigator for social sellingPerformance Tracking and Reporting: Track KPIs and sales performance, adjusting strategies to stay aligned with business growth goalsWhat you bring to the table:5+ years in B2B sales with experience in the Interior Design, Event Planning, or adjacent design industriesBachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, or a related design fieldDemonstrated success in new business acquisition and territory development, preferably in design-related B2B salesAn eye for design and a genuine passion for aesthetics, with the ability to connect with creative professionals and speak their languageHighly motivated self-starter who thrives in ambiguity and knows how to build from scratchProficient with HubSpot, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, and other sales tools; understands how to use social media for prospecting and brand buildingAble to craft compelling presentations and messages that inspire designers and align with their aesthetic valuesWillingness to travel up to 30–40% for client meetings, trade shows, and eventsTravel for remote team members: At Balsam Brands, we believe that time spent together, in-person, collaborating and building relationships is important to who we are. For our newest remote Brandits, we will arrange travel to one of our local offices within your first three months of employment so you can meet and train with your new team in-person. You may also get to travel an additional 1 – 2 times a year for events such as team retreats, offsites, or learning and development opportunities.Notes:This is a full-time, permanent position with benefits. Please only apply if you are able to live and work full-time in one of the states listed in this posting. State locations and specifics are subject to change as our hiring requirements shift.About Us:Balsam Brands is a global, omnichannel retailer with roots in holiday and home décor. We strive for excellence in everything we do and present a unique opportunity for those seeking to have a meaningful impact in a people-first company that values relationship building, authenticity, and doing the right thing. We have steadily growing teams in Boise, the Bay Area, Dublin, the Philippines, Canada, and Mexico.The company's mission is to create joy together. We empower our team and partners to love what they do, provide products and experiences that inspire meaningful moments with family and friends, and give back to our families and communities in impactful ways. When you join Balsam Brands, you'll find a culture of caring people doing challenging work and building a welcoming workplace.Check out our flagship brand, Balsam Hill: www.balsamhill.comBalsam Brands in Forbes: https://bit.ly/balsambrandsforbes2023LinkedIn: http://www.linkedin.com/company/balsam-brands/Glassdoor: https://bit.ly/balsambrands-glassdoorAt Balsam Brands, we strive to offer a competitive compensation and benefits package. For permanent, full-time team members, our current package includes:Competitive compensation, including a cash-based incentive plan; salary is reviewed yearly and may be adjusted as part of the normal compensation review processComprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage, with 100% of monthly premiums covered for team members, and 85%+ employer-paid premiums for other coverage tiers that include dependentsUp to $2,000 annual funding toward HSA accountsMedical, transit, dependent care FSAInfertility coverage offered on all medical plansGenerous parental leave program and flexible return optionsCompany-paid life and AD&D insuranceCompany-paid short and long-term disability insurance401(k) with dollar-for-dollar company match up to $4,000 per calendar yearEmployee Assistance Program (EAP) and other mental health and wellness perksPaid holidays, annual shutdown week, PTO, and volunteer time-off (VTO) packagesPaid 5-week sabbatical leave after 10 years of employmentAnnual continuous learning benefit up to $1,000 per person, per fiscal yearUp to $300 flexible reimbursement to support setup of new team member's work-from-home environmentGenerous team member merchandise discountValuable extras: identity theft protection, subsidized parking, monthly wellness, pet insurance, accident & critical illness insuranceThe base pay range for this position is: $110,000 to $130,000 annually, depending on experience. Year 1 On-Target Earnings (OTE): $150,000–$175,000, including a $30,000 commission draw during ramp-up. Year 2 OTE: $200,000+ based on performance. Please note that placement within the posted salary range is based on several factors, including geographic location, experience, skills, alignment with role requirements and other job-related factors. It is uncommon for offers to be made at the top of the range, as this typically reflects a candidate who exceeds all role requirements and brings significant, directly applicable experience. We benchmark our pay ranges against current external data sources and regularly review compensation for our team members. Balsam Brands is committed to providing our team members with an internally fair, externally competitive, and fiscally prudent total compensation package administered in a simple and consistent manner.At Balsam Brands, we strive to build a diverse, equitable, and inclusive team to fulfill our purpose to create joy together. Balsam Brands is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage people from all backgrounds, ages, abilities, and experiences to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, national origin, citizenship, marital or family status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy or caregiver status, veteran status, or any other legally protected status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations to participate in the job application and interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.#RemoteAdditional InformationAll your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

In this role, you'll be more than just a page updater; you'll manage product launches, refine how we handle digital assets, and help improve our behind-the-scenes processes. You'll work closely with various teams to ensure our customers have a seamless experience every time they visit us. If you have a keen eye for details and enjoy creating systems that make work easier, we’d really like to hear from you.What You’ll Be DoingWebsite Content Update and MaintenanceEnsures accurate display of product and digital assets on customer-facing web pages by uploading and assigning appropriate data.Builds, updates, and maintains static or interactive web pages that ensure the latest digital assets and content information is presented to customers.Coordinates with cross-functional partners to accomplish site merchandising deliverables within set parameters and timeline.Ensures web page design and technical specifications are met, and digital assets are optimized to support the average load time goal of less than 6 seconds.Supports merchandising campaigns by updating website pages and implementing A/B Tests that follow design specifications and meet launch deadlines.Creates and maintains website coupons and promotions for cross-functional teams.Updates and maintains website navigation structure and ensures it follows business requirements and specifications.Creates, updates, and maintains Product Category Pages and ensures they meet technical requirements, including digital assets, metadata, page URL, and database queries.Assigns appropriate data to product and site imagery to ensure the accurate display on various customer-facing web pages.Site Audit and QAParticipates in New Product Information QA, and flags or resolves digital asset and product information issues and discrepancies.Conducts routine audit and QA to make sure the website is working as expected.Conducts routine audit and QA to make sure merchandising-related components and pages are updated as per the defined sales merchandising schedule.Participates in conducting business validation activities for newly launched functions and features to ensure they meet business requirements.DocumentationDirects the documentation of internal processes and acts on identified gaps to ensure efficient process flows.Monitors the timely update of all documentation and makes sure that it is housed in the appropriate knowledge base site.Troubleshooting and ResolutionTroubleshoots digital asset and product information issues using the digital asset management tool, product information management system, and content management system.Troubleshoot spikes in website average load time speed and coordinate with cross-functional teams to resolve and ensure the average load time goal of less than 6 seconds is met.Participates in troubleshooting activities during launch by identifying probable causes and providing a resolution to medium complexity bugs.Process ImprovementEnsures that the standards for uploading, naming, and categorizing assets are met by following the set standards for image organization.Identifies efficiency issues and creates tools or workarounds to improve turnaround times for various website operations tasks and the accuracy of the information found in all our websites.Proposes and drives roadmap initiatives that create either efficiency gains or a positive cost impact for the business.Project ManagementPlans all maintenance, updates, campaigns, and product launches, and maps out the work of the Website Operations team to cover all tasks needed within the set timeframe and with quality output. Educates and trains other teams on the use and functionality of various Ecommerce systems or tools, including Digital Asset System.Identifies risks in both small-scale scale to medium-complexity tasks and projects and applies mitigation measures.Participates in Technical meetings, project meetings, and retrospectives to raise challenges and incorporate future changes as agreed with various stakeholders.Digital Asset Management System (As Required)Acts as the primary owner of Digital Asset System, and other tools and processes by conducting regular housekeeping to remove or archive outdated data and update or scrub others for future reference or use.Ensures that the standards for uploading, naming, and categorizing assets are met by following the set standards for image organization.Educates and trains other teams on the use and functionality of various Ecommerce systems or tools, including Digital Asset System.Manages user accounts and portals for Widen usersOther Duties And ResponsibilitiesPerforms other duties that may be assigned from time to time.What we’re looking for ("Must-haves"):Bachelor’s Degree, preferably in Information Technology, Computer Science, MIS, or a related field.Minimum of two (2) to three (3) years relevant experience in a similar role.Familiarity with Ecommerce and how content impacts the customer experience.Experience working with a Content Management System (CMS), such as Hybris, Contentstack, or similar CMS platforms.Familiarity with Figma or similar tools.Ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams in a remote setup.Nice To HaveWorking knowledge of HTML and CSS.Experience using Widen or other Digital Asset Management (DAM) tools.Experience in Product Information Management (PIM) systems.Location:TheSenior eCommerce Operations Specialistposition is a remote working position for Balsam International Unlimited Company - Philippine ROHQ in Manila. Team members in the Philippines are located within Metro Manila, Bataan, Batangas, Bulacan, Cavite, Laguna, Pampanga, Rizal, and Tarlac areas only.Our Must-havesMust attend occasional in-person meetings.Must have a fast, reliable DSL, Fiber, or Broadband connection (not mobile or broadband stick) as the primary internet connection with a minimum actual speed of 50MBPS.Note:An online assessment will also be part of the recruitment process.Status:This is a full-time, permanent position with benefits.Hardware Provision:Company-issued Laptop will be provided on your first day.At Balsam International, we strive to offer a competitive compensation and benefits package. For permanent, full-time team members, this includes:Government-mandated Benefits (SSS, PAG-IBIG, PhilHealth)13th Month PayPaid Leaves. We use time off to rest, go on vacation, or just sleep in! Our paid time off is flexible to our needs.Internet Subsidy. With internet allowance, we are set up for success.Healthcare Coverage (+ 2 dependents). We worry less about rising medical costs with flexible quality healthcare benefits.Maternity, Paternity, and Solo Parent Benefit. We make sure parents are supported while they navigate work and family life.Continuous Learning and Professional Development Benefit. Our professional and personal development is fully supported. Whether it be online courses, workshops, or books!Mental Health Support. We manage work and life's challenges through Mental Health Day breaks, 24/7 professional counselling, and curated webinars.Company Incentive. An additional cash-based perk for all our Brandits based on the company's performance.Meeting and Team Building Allowance. Happy tummies make our meetings more fun and productive!Shutdown Week. We can spend more time on things that matter with an additional one-week paid time off on top of paid leaves.Volunteer Time Off. With two paid days off, we are able to volunteer for advocacies we believe in.Bereavement Leave. We get additional paid leaves when a loved one passes to grieve and provide immediate support to our families.Additional InformationAll your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Job Description

**Digital Marketing & Content Manager**

**Position Overview**

The Digital Marketing & Content Manager will plan, assist with creation and oversee digital content to align with marketing goals. This role is responsible for analyzing performance of content/campaigns across social media channels. This includes maintaining content calendars and sharing information across internal and external teams. There will be a strong focus on preparing and leading the social media strategy to drive engagement and brand awareness. They will communicate events and assets to digital partners, licensed and open market partners.

The manager will collaborate with the marketing team and other departments to develop online strategies that increase company brand awareness. They will make sure that all company communications have consistent messages across social and digital channels.

They will help identify processes, techniques, and opportunities for improvement of communication of assets and events. This person will work closely with the marketing team, sales team, licensed and open market teams and outside agencies. They should be able to work collaboratively and effectively across the team while focusing on action and learning. They also will measure how effective communications strategies are and suggest improvements.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Develop and lead a comprehensive content strategy that supports the business and marketing objectives
* Collaborate with copywriters, graphic designers and the marketing team to produce high-quality, on-brand content
* Create and manage content calendars, including scheduling and publishing organic posts
* Support content creation, including video/reels, interactive formats, and other digital assets
* Track, analyze, and report on content performance, providing insights and recommendations
* Manage influencer partnerships and evaluate ROI
* Stay current on industry trends, competitor activity, and consumer behavior

**Skills & Competencies**

* Expertise in social media strategy, execution, and performance analysis
* Proficiency in content formats including video, reels, interactive forms/features, and GIFs
* Strong project management skills with ability to lead cross-functional collaboration
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* High attention to detail, intellectual curiosity, and a self-motivated approach

**Required Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in marketing, business, communications, or related field
* 5-7 years of experience in digital marketing and social platform management
* Proven expertise with Meta, Pinterest, and TikTok, including content publishing and performance tracking
* Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
* Hybrid work arrangement: partial remote flexibility with required in-office days at corporate HQ in Bassett, VA

**Job Summary**The primary function of a Bobs Squad Support Associate is to represent Bob’s Discount Furniture and its products with honesty and integrity while providing exceptional support to guests through all stages of their journey. The goal of the Sales Support Associate is to support the omnichannel experience and to identify root causes of issues to assist stores efficiently in a timely manner.

**How We Will Support You**At Bob’s we understand there are many companies you can choose to work for, so, along with exceptional opportunities for career growth we offer a fun team-oriented work environment and great benefits! Let us tell you more.  
  
**Benefits & Perks-** We’ve got you covered! We believe in supporting our employees and their families in the best ways possible is a top priority. We focus on three core wellness pillars: Emotional, Physical and Financial. Below are just some of the benefits that we offer:  
  

* Feeling under the weather, we’ve got you covered! We offer Nationally provided Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance
* Paid Vacation, Personal Days, Sick Days, Holidays, work anniversary and your Birthday! After all, your birthday should be a holiday
* 401(k) Profit Sharing Plan with a Generous Company match!
* Pet Insurance to help keep your furry friends happy and healthy
* Life insurance – Employer-paid basic Life Insurance, with the option to add Voluntary Life Insurance as well!
* Financial Planning, Voluntary Legal Benefits and Wellness Plans
* We already offer value priced furniture, but on top of that we offer a Generous Employee Discount starting on your 1st day!
* Additional Employee Discounts through the “Hays Perks discount program” offering hundreds of online discounts from your favorite merchants.
* And so much more!

**Culture and Core Values-** At Bob's we have a set of core values that shape the decisions we make every day and help define our company culture. We are committed to creating a place as diverse as the communities we serve.

We promote Professional Development: In-person, virtually and offer an infinite library of on-demand classes in Workday Learning. We also offer Tuition Reimbursement as well as the BDF Education Foundation Scholarship Program open to employees and their dependents. Want to grow at Bob’s professionally? We look to promote from within our organization by having robust succession planning in place to ensure that our team members have the opportunity to advance their careers.  
  
**Responsibilities**

* Be consistently positive, enthusiastic, and respectful in all interactions with guests and co-workers.

* Update guest orders into the system accurately and completely across all store locations using BobsBoost.
* Accurately process payments; be responsible for security of cash and other legal tenders in the store and on the phone.
* Ensure the company’s assets are properly cared for and in good working condition.
* Answer national incoming calls and respond to guest queries in a timely and courteous manner.
* Stay well informed about Bob’s products, pricing and policies.
* Assist guests in using the most appropriate Bob’s systems.
* Maintain guest communication on all national open orders and communicate status with guests.
* Provide communication and guidance along the guest journey from pre-purchase to the day of delivery.
* Follow up and complete all training and tasks, including but not limited to, e-learnings and daily tasks assigned by the company and managers.
* Execute all behavioral and operational standards per company policies, procedures, and processes.
* Arrive to work on time dressed according to the Dress Code Policy on scheduled days, which includes being able to work weekends and major holidays per the company’s scheduling guidelines and Dress Code Policy.
* Support all company initiatives as directed by Bobs Squad Management or company.

* Ad hoc assignments that support the instore sales function, that include the CPU instore process

**Company Description**

California Closets Alberta is seeking talented, driven professionals who are passionate about interior design and exceptional client service. As a Sales & Design Consultant, you’ll join a collaborative team that values craftsmanship, precision, and creating spaces that truly enhance our clients’ lives.

You’ll bring a strong sales mindset, a consultative approach, and a genuine enthusiasm for design. We offer comprehensive training and ongoing development to help you thrive in a role that blends creativity, relationship-building, and strong earning potential.

This is an exciting opportunity to grow your career while contributing to a team that transforms homes with care and expertise.

 **Job Description**  

* Represent the brand professionally with a confident, warm, and solutions-driven approach
* Conduct in-home or virtual consultations to complete detailed needs analyses
* Design custom organizational solutions using CAD software (laptop/iPad provided)
* Deliver a consultative sales experience that focuses on win-win outcomes
* Attend monthly sales and skills-development meetings
* Maintain consistent follow-up with clients and collaborate with the installation team to ensure seamless project completion
* Cultivate referrals and repeat business through excellent client relationships

  
  **Qualifications**

The ideal candidate will bring:

* Experience or education in interior design or a strong ability to translate client needs into design driven sales solutions
* Proven success in sales or customer facing roles where relationship building and trust directly drive repeat and referral business
* Demonstrated ability to consistently achieve or surpass sales targets, with a strong focus on closing and revenue growth
* Confidence in promoting and selling premium products
* Proficiency with basic computer programs; CAD experience is an asset
* Creativity paired with meticulous attention to detail and a focus on quality
* Ability to manage multiple projects in a dynamic environment
* A collaborative, team-oriented mindset
* Class 5 Driver’s License and access to a personal vehicle

  
  **Additional Information**

**Compensation & Benefits**

* Full-time, Monday-Friday with some evenings and occasional weekends
* Ability to work in Edmonton showroom
* 12 weeks of paid, on- the- job training
* Benefits after 3 months: Dental, extended health care and health spending account
* Commission and bonus-based pay structure

**What we provide:**

At California Closets, we invest in your success:

* **Flexible Schedule**: Split schedule including some evenings, weekend and showroom shifts

* **Training and Development:** Extensive onboarding, 10 weeks of classroom training and on-going coaching
* **Competitive Pay**: Commission- based structure, bonuses and allowances for fuel and cell phone
* **Employee Perks:** Employee discount program

**Why Join Us?** Be part of a team that values inclusivity, collaboration, and innovation. At California Closets, we’re passionate about creating beautiful, functional spaces – and equally passionate about the people who make that possible. Your work will make a meaningful difference in the lives of our clients, one space at a time.

**Company Description**Founded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority in premium space management, delivering custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. We believe home is more than just a place — it should be a source of creativity, comfort, and connection. From beautiful walk-in closets and entertainment centers to versatile pantries and home offices, we design custom storage solutions that add value to your life and home by making space for what belongs. Think of it as ‘practical magic.’  
  
**Job Description**The Sales Supervisor role focuses on ensuring that company sales goals are met or exceeded including achieving all key business metrics while following the California Closets policies and procedures. This role ensures that the designers are delivering on the California Closets standards of excellence with each and every customer. The Sales Supervisor also collaborates with the Sales Manager to ensure that the process flow is being followed and delivering on a high standard of customer service at all touchpoints.  
  
**What We Offer**California Closets has both company-owned and franchise locations. This location is a franchise, therefore earns the following benefits:  
  

* A fun, creative, and inclusive work environment
* Compensation is Salary plus a commission based on sales. Approximately $75k annually.
* Health insurance – Medical, and Dental
* Paid Vacation and Sick time
* Simple IRA retirement plan with company match
* Company phone number

Company-owned locations may offer different benefits.  
  
**Essential Functions**

* Coach and mentor, an assigned team of Design Consultants ensuring all company revenue goals and key performance indicators are met or exceeded through monthly (Goal Setting & Review Meetings) GS&R’s.
* Ensure direct reports are delivering on an exception customer experience with every customer touch point and follow up on completed procedures per company policy
* Performance manages underperformers following performance management guidelines to improve results including detailed documentation, may have to include HR and General Manager.
* Collaborate with Sales Manager to ensure all mandatory training is completed as per training strategy for new and on-going training and development.
* Working in collaboration with the Sales Manager to ensure the assigned Design Team has the appropriate mix of company leads and self-generated leads.
* Work with Design Consultants to create a plan for driving self-generated leads.
* Manage day-to-day performance of all sales team members
* Co-Manage sales contests and incentive programs and collaborate with the Sales Manager on creation and tracking.
* Working in collaboration with Sales Manager to co-schedule and co-facilitate monthly Sales Meeting including coordination with guest speakers.
* Analyze sales data and develop strategy to address areas of opportunity.
* Monitor and enforce sales team’s participation in local industry meetings and functions (i.e. BIA, Chamber of Commerce, and ASID).

**Qualifications**

* High school diploma and/or GED, some college education preferred
* Interior design education, direct industry experience or proven passion for home décor.
* 5+ years of direct selling consultative sales experience within a business to consumer environment, preferably in high-end furniture, design showrooms, or luxury retail environments
* 3+ years of management/leadership experience
* Proven track record of leading a team to exceed sales quotas and sales metrics

**Additional Information***We are an equal opportunity employer.*All your information will be kept confidential.

**Job Description**We’re seeking a Senior Salesforce Marketing Cloud Specialist who is a data-driven decision maker and marketing enthusiast to help drive our email marketing program. The ideal candidate has a strong track record of leveraging Salesforce Marketing Cloud to deploy technically-advanced email campaigns that enhance customer engagement and drive business results. With a passion to dive deep, this candidate has a strong technical background and project management skills with attention to detail, and a track record of transforming email marketing performance data into digestible, actionable insights. You’ll work cross-functionally with marketing, analytics, and CRM teams to create advanced customer journeys, automated workflows, dynamic content, and system integrations. The ideal candidate is an expert in Salesforce Marketing Cloud tools, scripting languages, and marketing automation best practices.  
  
We foster a values-based, collaborative environment and are seeking candidates who know how to drive growth while building deep partnerships. As a key driver of California Closets’ growth, this role works in partnership with cross-functional teams, and drives the results for a high-impact, high-visibility marketing channel, offering significant opportunities to make a meaningful impact on meeting our business objectives. The Senior Salesforce Marketing Cloud Specialist will report to the Senior Director, Relationship Marketing (CRM).  
  
Pay - $95K +  
  
**TECHNICAL EXECUTION**

* Advanced experience building, managing, and optimizing email campaigns specifically within Salesforce Marketing Cloud
* Hands-on experience leveraging Journey Builder, Automation Studio, Audience Builder, and Content Builder to deploy personalized, dynamic campaign flows and automations and create advanced multi-step customer journeys
* Create and troubleshoot automated workflows and data processes to support real-time, triggered messaging
* Proficient with building Data Extensions, conducting data imports and exports, and utilizing AMPscript to populate personalized attributes into emails
* Support integration with Marketing Cloud Connect and integrating SFMC with Salesforce CRM for triggered sends and real-time personalization
* Expert in Salesforce Marketing Cloud data architecture, including Contact Builder, Data Extensions, and Data Views
* Working knowledge of html, CSS, AMPscript, and responsive design

**EMAIL TRAFFIC AND PROJECT MANAGEMENT**

* Submit creative briefs and partner with cross-functional teams to take emails from concept to delivery
* Help develop and maintain the monthly/quarterly email content calendar in collaboration with creative and marketing teams
* Proficiency in Figma for email design collaboration, proofing, and QA
* Thoroughly QA all email assets (email lists, subject lines, content blocks, links, dynamic fields, and imaging) across multiple devices and email clients before launch to ensure successful execution

**REPORTING**

* Strong analytical capabilities with expertise in email data analysis and performance reporting
* Experience analyzing performance metrics and creating detailed campaign reports to translate insights into actionable improvements
* Proficient with using Salesforce Marketing Cloud Intelligence Reports to create dashboards and visualizations
* Expertise using Google Analytics (G4) or similar web analytics platform to leverage data and metrics to drive campaign improvements

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Analytics, or related field
* Salesforce Certified Marketing Cloud Email Specialist
* Salesforce Certified Marketing Cloud Administrator
* 5-7 years of professional hands-on email marketing experience, ideally at an agency or within a premium lifestyle brand
* Strong experience with Excel for data manipulation, charts and pivot tables

**Additional Information**Find us on Facebook, YouTube, and Instagram  
  
*We are an equal opportunity employer. We E-Verify.*All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

**Job Description**We are seeking a strategic Senior Growth Marketing Manager with a strong focus on Paid Search including Bing and Google Paid Search, Demand Gen, Performance Max, and YouTube campaigns. This role will be responsible for using data-driven insights to develop and own paid search strategies, manage media budgets, drive campaign execution, and work cross-functionally to achieve growth and ROI objectives. You understand the full search landscape to identify opportunities where paid and organic search can work together to maximize performance.  
  
While this role is focused on paid search, we’re seeking a candidate that is aware of the greater paid digital ecosystem including broadcast, streaming and OTT advertising, paid social, affiliate marketing and their potential impacts on paid search performance. The ideal candidate has a passion for problem-solving, a data-first mindset, and excellent communication skills. You will be part of the Growth Marketing team—a collaborative group of marketers working to expand brand awareness and generate demand for California Closets through conversations with the customer, optimizing their brand experience from awareness through first contact.  
  
Base salary for this range is $130k - $150k + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. This is a remote position, however there is occasionally travel required about 3-5x per year.  
  
**Responsibilities**

* Lead planning, management, and execution of all California Closets Paid Search campaigns, including account setup, strategy development, campaign structure, budget management, bidding strategies, and invoice/billing oversight.
* Manage budgets exceeding $10M, including market-specific billing details and reporting to internal finance teams.
* Direct and manage digital agency to define, execute, and measure marketing campaigns across paid media channels including SEM, YouTube video and display, programmatic, and retargeting.
* Guide agency efforts in keyword research, competitive analysis, and audience targeting to uncover growth opportunities and mitigate risks.
* Leverage SEO insights to inform keyword strategy, landing page relevance, and overall search visibility.
* Demonstrate a passion for data and problem-solving, with the ability to extract insights, interpret anomalies, and identify key performance trends.
* Review campaign performance by market/DMA and collaborate with local business owners and managing operators to align strategies with specific objectives.
* Drive continuous improvement and experimentation to meet and exceed monthly volume and ROAS targets.
* Engage regularly with agency and platform account teams to assess performance, adopt optimal solutions, and evolve strategies in response to the dynamic paid search landscape.
* Develop and execute a data-driven YouTube advertising strategy aligned with California Closets’ business goals.
* Collaborate across Growth, Tech, Operations, Solutions, and Brand teams to ensure alignment of paid search initiatives with company growth initiatives & business objectives.
* Conduct attribution analysis to understand how media mix impacts paid search performance, including visitor volume and quality.
* Maintain awareness of SEO trends and algorithm updates to ensure paid search strategies complement organic efforts.
* Monitor industry trends and competitor activities to identify opportunities for innovation and growth in paid search advertising.
* Ensure compliance with corporate privacy and data governance policies for all internal and third-party efforts.

**Job Description**We’re seeking a Senior Salesforce Marketing Cloud Specialist who is a data-driven decision maker and marketing enthusiast to help drive our email marketing program. The ideal candidate has a strong track record of leveraging Salesforce Marketing Cloud to deploy technically-advanced email campaigns that enhance customer engagement and drive business results. With a passion to dive deep, this candidate has a strong technical background and project management skills with attention to detail, and a track record of transforming email marketing performance data into digestible, actionable insights. You’ll work cross-functionally with marketing, analytics, and CRM teams to create advanced customer journeys, automated workflows, dynamic content, and system integrations. The ideal candidate is an expert in Salesforce Marketing Cloud tools, scripting languages, and marketing automation best practices.  
  
We foster a values-based, collaborative environment and are seeking candidates who know how to drive growth while building deep partnerships. As a key driver of California Closets’ growth, this role works in partnership with cross-functional teams, and drives the results for a high-impact, high-visibility marketing channel, offering significant opportunities to make a meaningful impact on meeting our business objectives. The Senior Salesforce Marketing Cloud Specialist will report to the Senior Director, Relationship Marketing (CRM).  
  
**TECHNICAL EXECUTION**

* Advanced experience building, managing, and optimizing email campaigns specifically within Salesforce Marketing Cloud
* Hands-on experience leveraging Journey Builder, Automation Studio, Audience Builder, and Content Builder to deploy personalized, dynamic campaign flows and automations and create advanced multi-step customer journeys
* Create and troubleshoot automated workflows and data processes to support real-time, triggered messaging
* Proficient with building Data Extensions, conducting data imports and exports, and utilizing AMPscript to populate personalized attributes into emails
* Support integration with Marketing Cloud Connect and integrating SFMC with Salesforce CRM for triggered sends and real-time personalization
* Expert in Salesforce Marketing Cloud data architecture, including Contact Builder, Data Extensions, and Data Views
* Working knowledge of html, CSS, AMPscript, and responsive design

**EMAIL TRAFFIC AND PROJECT MANAGEMENT**

* Submit creative briefs and partner with cross-functional teams to take emails from concept to delivery
* Help develop and maintain the monthly/quarterly email content calendar in collaboration with creative and marketing teams
* Proficiency in Figma for email design collaboration, proofing, and QA
* Thoroughly QA all email assets (email lists, subject lines, content blocks, links, dynamic fields, and imaging) across multiple devices and email clients before launch to ensure successful execution

**REPORTING**

* Strong analytical capabilities with expertise in email data analysis and performance reporting
* Experience analyzing performance metrics and creating detailed campaign reports to translate insights into actionable improvements
* Proficient with using Salesforce Marketing Cloud Intelligence Reports to create dashboards and visualizations
* Expertise using Google Analytics (G4) or similar web analytics platform to leverage data and metrics to drive campaign improvements
